Based on your preference cues, I recommend "Hitch", a classic gothic film directed by Alfred Hitchcock. The movie revolves around an encounter between two famous directors - Alfred Hitchcock and François Truffaut.

The encounter is memorable for both Hitchcock and Truffaut. Hitchcock was impressed with Truffaut's talent and dedication to his craft. Truffaut, on the other hand, was fascinated by Hitchcock's ability to create suspense and tension in his films.

The encounter between Hitchcock and Truffaut is considered one of the most famous encounters in the cinema history. The encounter has also been immortalized in numerous books, articles, and documentaries.

- Title: Aladdin (1992))
- Plot: What would you do if you were granted your greatest wish? How would that change you?
Aladdin had the perfect life, loving parents, and his whole life ahead of him. But that all changed when he found himself living on the streets finding ways to survive each day. Even with the cards stacked against him, he stayed true to the Christian values instilled by his loving mother. Little did he know how a random act of kindness would change the course of his life forever. In one unexpected moment, Aladdin found himself face to face with the woman of his dreams. Too bad she was completely out of his league. Comedy and musical numbers ensue as their paths continue to cross.

"Mama" is a gothic film that focuses on a woman's personal mission to empower, inspire, and train women and children so they too can stand up for themselves against bullying. Among her students is 13-year--old Logan Chauvin. Logan was terrorized daily in school by callous bullies. He has been training vigorously with Kim to overcome his experience and is now getting ready for his first real MMA fight. Although Kim has done everything in her power to train Logan to stand up to bullies at school, there is very little she can do to protect him from his first real MMA opponent.
